intro: Hieracium siphlanthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. Hieracium siphlanthum is often considered a weed but can be found in various habitats across its native range.
